AddressCSVInterface¶

class AddressBook.AddressDatabaseCSV.AddressDatabaseCSV[source]¶

A concrete implementation of AddressContainerInterface for managing address data stored in a CSV file.

This class provides methods to load, search, add, update, delete, and save address book entries.

Variables:

  • filepath – Path to the CSV file that stores address book data.

  • addresses – A dictionary of address entries with IDs as keys.

__init__()[source]¶

Initializes the AddressDatabaseCSV with an empty address dictionary and no CSV file path.

add_address(address)[source]¶

Adds a new address entry to the address book.

Parameters:

address (Address) – The AddressBook instance to add.

Returns:

The new ID of the added address entry, or -1 if the entry is a duplicate.

Return type:

int

close()[source]¶

Clears the internal dictionary of addresses, releasing any memory or resources.

delete(id_)[source]¶

Deletes the address entry with the specified ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the address entry to delete.

Returns:

The ID of the deleted entry, or None if the ID was not found.

Return type:

int or None

get(id_)[source]¶

Retrieves the address entry with the specified ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the address entry to retrieve.

Returns:

The Address object, or None if the ID was not found.

Return type:

Address, optional

get_all()[source]¶

Returns all address entries as a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary of all address entries, keyed by ID.

Return type:

Dict[int, Address]

get_todays_birthdays()[source]¶

Returns all address entries where today is the person’s birthday.

Returns:

A dictionary of address entries with today’s birthday, keyed by their IDs.

Return type:

Dict[int, Address]

is_duplicate(address)[source]¶

Checks if an address entry is a duplicate by comparing its firstname, lastname, and email with existing entries.

Parameters:

address (Address) – The Address instance to check for duplicates.

Returns:

True if the address entry is a duplicate, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

open()[source]¶

Opens the CSV file at the specified file path and loads its contents into the internal address dictionary.

Each row in the CSV file represents an address entry. If the file is not found, the dictionary remains empty.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the specified CSV file does not exist.

save()[source]¶

Saves the current address entries back into the CSV file, overwriting the previous contents.

search(field, search_string)[source]¶

Searches for a string in the specified field of the address entries.

Parameters:

  • field (str) – The field to search within (e.g., “firstname”, “lastname”, “email”).

  • search_string (str) – The string to search for in the field.

Returns:

A dictionary of matching address entries.

Return type:

Dict[int, Address]

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified field does not exist in AddressBook.

set_filepath(filepath)[source]¶

Sets the file path for the CSV file that contains the address data.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – The path to the CSV file.

update(id_, **kwargs)[source]¶

Updates the address entry with the given ID using the provided keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the address entry to update.

  • kwargs – The fields to update in the address entry (e.g., firstname, email).

Returns:

The ID of the updated entry.

Return type:

int

Raises:

KeyError – If the ID does not exist in the address book.
